author: Zak Smith
description: Well. 3 crocodiles.

author: Zak Smith
description: MULK. Human settlement. Excellent glassblowers.

author: Harald Wagener
description: Hidden harbor. Base of a luckless pirate captain.

author: Jeremy Morgan
description: Abandoned witch's hut.

author: Brian Green
description: Burnt remains of a fishing village along the shore.  Sunken fishing boats in the shallows.

author: Random Wizard
description: A very old bard in a dinghy. Appears to be idly fishing but in reality, is attempting to find ways to capture a mermaid who taunts and jilts him.

author: Zzarchov Kowolski
description: Abandoned stone watchtower.  Someone burned down the roof and there is a pack of 20 feral dogs with a taste for human meat.

author: Jensan Thuresson
description: Unsinkable cursed buckets. Lots of.

author: Brendan S
description: Pirate patrols from the hilly island to the south that seek slaves (50% chance their ship is already loaded with precious cargo). 10% chance actually ghost pirates from a ship that was ran aground in a storm (there may be treasure in the real wreck as well).

author: Harald Wagener
description: The Cyclops´ armory. Believed to hold items of excellent craftmanship (true, but they're all giant sized)

author: James Stuart
description: Wet Water is Wet. There are lots of fish here.

author: Matt Maranda
description: The sunken remains of ships with several large rocks scattered among them. (These ships were sunk by the Cyclops before they ever reached his island.)

author: Zak Smith
description: One of the jellyfish here is being remotely controlled by a mind flayer in hex [[0109]]. He is using it to look for a lost gem in the shoals.

author: Alex Mayo
description: The remains of an old fishing settlement. A strange statue, clearly dredged from the ocean floor, is located in the center of town - surrounded by corpses.

author: Jensan Thuresson
description: Moonlight turns water surface into a portal.

author: Zak Smith
description: [[SCREEYAL]] White Elf port. Rough.

author: Jeff Rients
description: small pile of rocks near highest hilltop in the hex.  Hasty grave - underneath is the naked corpse of a halfling with tremendous sideburns.

author: Stuart Marshall
description: Scree and loose rock.  4 large pterosaurs.

author: Harald Wagener
description: [[UPSIDE]]  Dwarven surface colony. sturdy buildings, little luxury.

author: John Bell
description: One of the hills has an iron door cut into its side. A corpse with stab wounds in its back lies face down towards the door.

author: Nakia Pope
description: Ash and burnt vegetation from a huge wildfire.

author: John Bell
description: Drunken hill giant who loves to gamble.

author: Zak Smith
description: Dwarves here with trained rabid bats will steal your armor int he night and melt it down.

author: Matt Maranda
description: These mountains contain a sealed Dwarf Vault. The seal has not been broken largely because of the legends that claim "The Dwarfs that  founded this vault never left before the seal was put in place."

author: John Bell
description: One of the mountains is illusory, but chances are you won't realise til you're halfway up it.

author: Harald Wagener
description: A big telescope built by lizardmen, pointing at the stars. They buy lenses from the lens grinders in [[0217]].

author: Darien Mason
description: A desolate mountain peak strewn with bones of a decimated adventuring crew. One rather intact skeleton still clutches a red dragon scale the size of a great-shield.

author: Matt Maranda
description: at the top of this mountain carved into the living stone is a very small throne, too small even for a halfling. (Anyone small enough to sit in it can see all surface activity for 30 miles around, while seated in the chair. But no special power to actively process that information is imparted upon the user.)

author: John Bell
description: A massive statue of an ancient king points directly at the throne in [[0119]] with an accusing expression

author: John Johnson
description: Abandoned mines with a collapsed entrance.
Sheer cliffs over the water with caves high up.

author: Zak Smith
description: The palatial abandoned manse overlooking the water here is an illusion. It's really a rickety deathtrap covered by an illusion the cannibal witch-naga beneath cast so adventurers will fall to their doom.

author: Paul Schaefer
description: Crater with large crashed space capsule. Squishy aliens unloading parts to construct mechanical walking death machines.

author: John Bell
description: A flotilla of rafts inhabited by peaceful lizardmen plies a circular route throughout this hex.

author: Zak Smith
description: Two fortified islands linked by a stone bridge

author: Chris L Sheppard
description: A school of small green fish that form strange arcane symbols.

author: John Bell
description: Den of 4 werecrocodiles who prey on the lizardmen in [[0122]].

author: Matt Maranda
description: Excellent finish in the hex. Including one overly large shark with a suite of +1 chain in its belly.

author: Zak Smith
description: A skinny deep blue jelly with tentacles and 2 vampire heads.

author: Casey Garske
description: The top of a giant statue's head protrudes from the water. At low tide it's eyes are revealed.

author: John Bell
description: No one can prove a tribe of degenerate elvish cannibals live here because no one ever comes out of the forest alive.

author: Harald Wagener
description: Glade with portal to the Nymph's  Shadow Realm. Druids can find a pathway to hex [[2211]], traversable in a day (accompanied by Druid's level living beings).

author: Olman Feelyus
description: Marsh lands. Very difficult terrain to cross. No potable water.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Dank swamp land made passable by bridges of human bones. The air is thick with the stench of rotting flesh.

author: Zak Smith
description: Old squat Dwarven fortress. Wererats disguised as lost pilgrims inside. They have d20xd12 gp worth of stuff.

author: Casey Garske
description: The Mosquito Queen

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Dank swamp land made passable by bridges of human bones. The air is thick with the stench of rotting flesh. A massive hollow earthen mound sits above the murky water and is home to a clutch of flesh eaters.

author: Zak Smith
description: Quasit--ex-familiar of Mosquito Queen, created the hyper sophisticated lizardmen in [[0118]].

author: John Carr
description: Kelpies

author: Chris L Sheppard
description: Nothing. Absolutely, stinking, frigging, nothing. Will drive players mad looking since they’ve found something of interest on every other hex on the map.

author: Zak Smith
description: Hidden rocks--ships will probably founder. Pirates and scavengers from nearby ports know about this place

author: Mike Evans
description: Swamp village if mutated half fish half human creatures. Led by blind mad prophet.

author: Gennifer Bone
description: Sunken rowboat.  Here, a party of adventurers learned that armor doesn't float.

author: Chris L Sheppard
description: An orc in a  rowboat guarding a locked chest. Full of killer bees.

author: Mike Evans
description: Giant sits on a throne of living humans stitched together.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Salt water marsh as far as the eye can see. Long legged birds prey on fish in the shallows.

author: Harald Wagener
description: water in this hex boils at a 1-in-6 chance per night, 2-in-6 at a full moon, from sundown to sundawn.

author: Jacob Hurst
description: Wreck of pirate ship "The Yeasty Skulls" - Contains 2 forlorn ghosts. Chest of glass flowers.

author: Zak Smith
description: Water goblins in huge half-submerged fortress of trained coral.

author: Ian Burns
description: Village of 116 Rat Men who worship the corpse of a prehistoric mammoth. 2000 GP worth of valuables piled between its ribs. The skull was stolen two months ago by the giant in hex [[0212]].

author: Harald Wagener
description: Marble prison to a Nymph from [[0125]]. The key to her prison is a marble figurine of her likeness, at the bottom of 0202 near the sunken rowboat. If you free her, she grants you a wish.

author: Jacob Hurst
description: Clearing filled with small orange and white speckled mushrooms. Visions if consumed.

author: Paul Schaefer
description: Psychotropic seaweed grows on the seabed. Popular vacation spot for merpeople.

author: Zak Smith
description: VEKTH Largish port city here--half of it is on solid ground, half is linked boats and fishing towers.

author: Ian Burns
description: Undersea dome - rusting in places and of questionable constriction - hidden by a forest of purple and green kelp.

author: Levi Kornelsen
description: Docks, roads, inns - largely serving traffic to and from nearby [[VEKTH]] [[0209]].

author: Ian Burns
description: Mountain pass guarded by the Skull Baron, a insane giant, naked except for mammoth skull head stolen from the rat men in Hex [[0206]].

author: Chris L Sheppard
description: Twelve Lords a’ Leaping.   Twelve armored knights suffering from a permanent 'Otto’s Irresistible Dance'.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Bone yards of the Skull Baron, loaded with heaped detritus from his rampages, discarded remnants of his victims, plenty of scavenger monsters

author: Kerry Forester
description: natural hot springs

author: Ian Burns
description: Bloodcorn, village of 400 disheveled, and paranoid farmers. The corn grown in the surrounding fields bleeds and screams when bitten into.

author: Zak Smith
description: Inn of the Night Goat d6 minus d4 travelers at any time. Barkeep's has an accurate treasure map in a map case  in his room to an underground complex in [[1423]] inhabited by trolls.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Fertile steppe land populated by wild herds of huge black goats with the faces of men, also known as night goats.

author: Ian Burns
description: one-eye grizzly bear feared by the surrounding locals.

author: Levi Kornelsen
description: Abandoned mining camp, spoil heaps, equipment, from mines in [[0120]].  Road leading to that abandoned mine past the feet of the giant seated statue also in [[0120]].

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Encampment of fantasy hippies, protected from harm by overwhelming stench of arcane incense

author: Casey Garske
description: A surly herd of aurochs led by a very short-tempered bull who HATES halflings.

author: Matthew Burack
description: Ruins of a burned-out farmstead with skeletal remains scattered about. Fields are overgrown with weeds, but have fresh crop circles in them.

author: Zak Smith
description: Nizadd Gors was transformed into a wererat by a cursed scroll sold to him by a merchant in [[SCREEYAL]] [[0112]]. He seeks information and revenge.

author: Levi Kornelsen
description: Lizardman encampment; this tribe of primitive lizardmen were subjected to arcane experiments by outsiders see [[0128]] , and the successes taken away.  They remain embittered.

author: Paul Schaefer
description: Two large clans of primitive cannibals. They are feuding over an ancient recipe for barbecue sauce.

author: Zak Smith
description: Spell scroll hidden in knot of unusually twisted tree beneath overgrown crow's nest. Permanency . Castable by anyone but only works once.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Caravan from Mulk laden with high-end glassware, lost, bewildered, guards depleted from monster attacks, near starvation, still they soldier on, devoted to fulfilling their orders to the south

author: Zak Smith
description: On a small island is an apparently abandoned tower taken by The Cold Banner--a cult of mute assassins dedicated to Akayle Ozph, the many-faced god.

author: Paul Schaefer
description: Tiny islands randomly rise and sink here, usually within hours. Prides of aquatic displacer beasts hunt in these waters.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Beneath the waves the Aquanarium of Bubblox the Sea Wizard lurks on a rocky outcropping near the edge of an abyssal trench.

author: Darien Mason
description: a bustling port town, nearby healing spring houses symbiotic parasites than actually run the town.

author: Ben Djarum
description: The Oakheart Academy for Wayward Girls is nestled in the rugged hills here. It is actually a front for the Slime Sisters of Jubilex - an odious cult of depraved nuns devoted to the Slime God.

author: Zak Smith
description: Abandoned fortress of the Order of The Nine Dozen. Mostly picked over (unless there's a secret door somewhere) still, offers shelter from the elements.

author: Paul Schaefer
description: The retired bard H'Timskaz resides here in the port town of Ratzenrop. He now makes his living by selling sandals, togas and headbands to fashion challenged visitors at the local inn.

author: Casey Garske
description: Plesiosaur mating ground

author: Paolo Greco
description: sunken ship. in the hold, granite icon of Saint Gunther of the Uplands. Praying in front of it gives the faithful +1 to hit and damage with crossbows until next dawn

author: Zak Smith
description: Thin string of half-submerged fortresses linked by a crumbling causeway connecting [[0407]] to [[0608]]. Once part of the western defenses in the The Bleak Wars, a lunatic has taken up residence in one.

author: Jacob Hurst
description: A 3 mile long trail is marked with crucified rabbits every 500 feet. The trail ends in a clearing containing the stump of a large oak tree.

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Bottomless cave. Three servants of Ith-Narmant, Master of Shadows, are building a shrine in its black depths.

author: Jacob Hurst
description: The canyon lands of the screaming arches. Wind(?) blowing through natural rock arch ways sounds like the screams of the dying.

author: Gennifer Bone
description: Black Tar Pits.  Pitch Elementals have been known to spawn here.

author: Zak Smith
description: The Devilwide--a popular dueling ground for local nobles. 70% of seeing at least one duel if traveling on foot through this hex, 40% on horseback.

author: Casey Garske
description: Village of Scoble. Will warn about the weirdos who grow the screaming corn in [[0215]].

author: Eric Boyd
description: GALASSA, halfling village, 900 residents,  exports barley; sherrif, innkeeper, 3d20 more relatively prominent residents secretly worship and offer blood sacrifices to a minor demon prince.

author: Zak Smith
description: Astrologer's tower was destroyed some weeks ago by the weird golem thing in [[0318]]. It was searching for something it could not find.

author: Zak Smith
description: A crag on this peak bears the mark of dark rites. A ranger can identify the bones as those of elven children (a rare thing).

author: Trent B
description: Alchemist lady, Rebecca Flaskhaver, lives under a stone outcrop in a forested valley between the peaks. Likes to test substances on nearby corn farmers (02 15). Will trade powerful magic/potions/powders for humanoid babies.

author: James Smith
description: A Mechanical Walking Death Machine from [[0121]]. Systematically destroying all vegetation, in search of the Nymph's Portal in [[0125]].

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Field of arms. 2d100+100 undead soldier skeletons from a bygone wizard war are buried here, each with one of their arms sticking out of the ground. Pulling one out is not recommended.

author: Darien Mason
description: a tribe of raptor riding goblins aids travelers in distress. Their leader wears a ratty red cloak and mask.

author: Zak Smith
description: Corpse of dark elf traveler. Carrying standard dungeoneering gear--rope, torches, rations, etc.

author: Casey Garske
description: The Needle. A thin mountain with an oval hole in the peak. When the moon rises behind it, the light shining through illuminates a secret temple of the Moon Goddess.

author: Michael Currie
description: Wheretewhakawi plateau, arid and pungent with the stench of gorgonzola. Several Naga zealots have taken residence in the flab of Pukurangi, a giant clairavoyant mooncalf.

author: Darien Mason
description: a ghostly troupe of murdered actors follows the party, critiquing their "performance".

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Wererat assassin who killed the dark elf in [[0320]] and took his ring of spiderform. The assassin is on its way back to  the dwarven fortress in [[0126]].

author: Zak Smith
description: Remains of a huge merchant caravan. Carrion crawlers poking through it at night, wild boars during the day.

author: Trent B
description: Wooden fortress on a hilltop, populated by 140 hardy wo/men. Forage and hunt, not much farming. Small mine to extract copper for trade etc. - Equipment/hirelings/henchpeople available. - Will share good information on any nearby area (up to 4 hexes away) in exchange for luxurious commodities.

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Snakehill path. A merchant with a wagon full of strange wares is missing his son, who was kidnapped by the Mosquito Queen's soldiers from [[0127]].

author: Zak Smith
description: Former fortified city, abandoned and crumbling, full of snake eggs. The pythons here feed on sadness and will attack the loneliest party members first.

author: Michael Currie
description: Large rubbish dump . Several belligerent lizardchildren hang around breaking bottles and smoking cigarettes.

author: Zak Smith
description: Friendly helpful, generous merchants vessel need a hand being pulled to shore. For real.

author: Trent B
description: A pod of dolphins are often in this hex. They are familiar with the submerged parts of the whole region.

author: Ray Colina
description: A talking sea monster dwells beneath the waters here. There is a 15% chance a passing ship will catch its eye. It isn't necessarily hostile, but it will want something.

author: Levi Kornelsen
description: The currents and flows here strongly suggest hidden rocks and shallow sandbars - but none are actually present. Experienced local sailors will know about this.

author: Matt Maranda
description: This area contains a school of semi-intelligent squid (Int 5). They hunt in this area and will even attacks sailors that fish them. Attempt to communicate with them can be made.

author: Trent B
description: A single undead human lives at the bottom of the river, occasionally creeping out to steal away an easy target from the port in [[0304]]. Has treasure from victims in it's lair.

author: James Smith
description: Several bottles, containing notes may be found here and there. A young inmate of the Oakheart Academy in [[0305]], pleading for help.

author: Zak Smith
description: At the bottom of the water there is a great circular stone with a glyph on it. Removing it reveals an entrance to the dungeon.

author: Darien Mason
description: A crowd of children wearing cursed buckets from [[0107]] as helmets have amassed here led by a mysterious force. They carry pot lids as shields and farm implements as weapons and prepare to storm the dungeon entrance.

author: Asen R Georgiev
description: The giant raft with a population of albinoes, simply known as "the Albino island". The albinoes are rich people who dwell on this artificial island, protected by golem guards, waiting for a cure of their condition to come from the sea according to a prediction. The cure is to be related to the monster from hex [[0402]], but they don't know that.

author: Zak Smith
description: Abandoned halfling merchant vessel. Inside there are 4 leech-headed halflings and the diary of a butcher who escaped the cult in Galassa [[0315]].

author: Darien Mason
description: That's the hex-eating mega purple worm.

author: Bennet Akkerman
description: Cursed albatross; will follow any sailing ship; wind strength will be lower than normal, but will be increased in case of a storm. The killer of the albatross will be cursed (can only consume salt water instead of fresh water).

author: Eric Boyd
description: Once you get a bag of salt, that's kind of a blessing; it's a lot easier to make fresh water salty than t'other way round. Maybe all your clothes and possessions are permanently crusted with seaweed and salt, -1 to dex and your items wear out/break often?

author: Ray Colina
description: There is an excellent sheltered bay here, unfortunately strong uncooperative currents make sailing into the bay all but impossible. A tribe of wood giants lives here, they will trade lumber and amber for iron.

author: Bennet Akkerman
description: A wizard growing crying mushrooms will pay handsomely for the hand of an hanged elf. Pays double for the hand of a White Elf, triple in the case of a White Elf magic user, knows the location of [[SCREEYAL]] [[0112]].

author: Random Wizard
description: A quaint, rustic inn with a wood sign proclaiming "The Green Dragon Inn" sits on a path winding through the mountains. A strange book titled "FLAILSNAILS" in the reading room hint at magic portals in the extensive wine cellar linking the inn to other wine cellars throughout the multiverse.

author: Darien Mason
description: At dawn, those who view the cliff side will see inscribed the names of everyone who worked on this hexmap. PCs who gaze upon it will be refreshed, but will forget about it entirely once they look away.

author: Ben Djarum
description: A caravan of dancers, performers and musicians have made camp in this small grassy valley. Amongst their belongings in their wagon is a large wooden box containing a vampire.

author: Dave Booth
description: Man sits on a stump. Will smile and give a knowing nod and encouraging thumbs-up to passers-by.

author: Darien Mason
description: The plants in this forest wander about on shuffling roots. The animals either cling like vines or are rooted by their legs to the ground.

author: Brendan S
description: Blasted moonscape hidden in the marsh (division between healthy swamp and dead area is clear as a line) and anything that dies within the dead zone will reanimate as undead during the next night (all vegetation is also undead). Ancient underground necromantic laboratory buried somewhere, corrupting the whole area.

author: Ben Djarum
description: A ruined village sinks in the stagnant murk. A half orc offers you a ride in his boat through the ruins for 10 gp. Sitting on the roof of one of the buildings is a strange child with no eyes who warns adventurers to beware the "man who smells like blood"

author: Michael Currie
description: A decaying mausoleum half hidden by brambleberries is home to a small band of evil rapist Deodands. The Tombs inside contain D10x20gps worth of golden jewellery and a cursed tiara of resist pleasure.

author: Ray Colina
description: A skull-faced Amazon with a large hellhound wanders here, seeking the location of the dungeon in hex [[0406]]. The Amazon wears a tattered cloak made from thirteen demon faces sewn together. The faces whisper dark secrets and make prophecies of doom about random people, 10% chance one of the faces mentions someone the PC’s know.

author: Dave Booth
description: Mountain fortress housing 28 pterodactyl riding bandits. They have imprisoned the former owner (a wind druid) and are forcing him to keep the 2d12 'dactyls docile. Fortress contains 3d100x100gp worth of goods, supplies and valuables stolen from nearby settlements.

author: Edgar Johnson
description: Titanic arm made of black, very hard metal makes a lewd gesture toward what used to be a contended border. Chance of rock slides.

author: Noah Marshall
description: Ruined mountain pass fortress of Doram. Clay Golem soldiers continue to collect toll-fee in the now overflowing, trap-ridden vault.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: A dusty road twists through this bleak rock scape. It passes along sheer cliffs and over a rusted iron bridge of bizarre craftsmanship. The road leads to the Fortress of Doram.

author: Dave Booth
description: Come see the famous Dungeon of Dread!

author: Matt Maranda
description: This snow capped mountain is the home to a cult that worships the 3' tall purple cacti. The petals are used to brew a ritual tea said to give the faithful greater understanding of the world around them.

author: Anthony Picaro
description: Irregular mounds of earth, the remains of several fires, and trees that twist unnaturally on themselves to precariously grip intricately carved wooden boxes mark this secluded place an ancient graveyard. The solitary gravetender – a scrawny, naked man caked all over with red clay (Cleric 5) – will bury a corpse (thus preventing it from rising as undead) for a donation of good food, Speak with Dead for a donation of good drugs, or allow PCs to remove a corpse for the donation of a fresher, more powerful (higher HD or level) humanoid specimen.

author: Noah Marshall
description: A band of 2d4 Mountain Gorillas. They have some rudimentary knowledge of weapon and armor usage.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: Lonely shepherd guards 2d10 yaks.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: The ground here is littered with stone turtles. An evil skeleton loiters in the area waiting to trick passers-by with its bogus prophecies.

author: Ray Colina
description: Schools of crystalline-flying fish with razor sharp wings frequent these waters, 50% chance of encounter. If caught they can fetch a decent price from the right buyer.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: A ramshackle boat full of sea hippies cruises about looking for a market for their hand crafted doo-dads.

author: Reece Carter
description: its rumoured that there is an opening to an underwater cavern here. when inside of said cavern you can breath water as though it was air (water acts as air), but air can cause you to drown (treat as water)

author: Alex Williamson
description: A long abandoned catamaran is anchored above a pearl bed inhabited by giant oysters and 4 Ixitxachitl who prey on those who may investigate.

author: Adam Thornton
description: Shoals off the coast are full of stinging jellyfish.  Sea cows here moan in suspiciously human voices.

author: David Pretty
description: Reef!  A Seamanship / Navigation check is required or your vessel will run aground.  Some spots are so shallow swimmers can climb up and be completely out of the water.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Thunderous surf crashes on beaches of black volcanic sand. Indigenous monkey people sift diamonds from the sands with loose weave wicker baskets.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: Secret beach hosts massive Ghost Dance on the full moon.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Colorful coral reefs lie just below the waters surface. This is the spawning place of the merfolk.

author: Jeff Rients
description: The fishing is really good here, so good even untrained observers will notice it.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: Burnt remains of viking funeral barge under the water. Full of the usual viking treasure and rotting skeletal warriors.

author: Alex Williamson
description: The last remaining pylon of a colossal basalt bridge that spanned from [[0407]] to [[0608]] rises from the water here. It is now used as the nesting place for several families of giant albatross. Their eggs are prized for those who would use the young as mounts.

author: Ben Djarum
description: A wild-haired man, his body covered in strange symbols, is tied screaming to a raft.

author: Justin Howe
description: Three barrels of brandy float in the water. They fell off a smuggler's ship in a storm.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: Rocky cliffs prevent landing.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Low sandy hills infested with smart mouth harpies.

author: Anthony Picaro
description: This mountain is an active volcano with an eruption impending; roll 1d12 each time PC pass by or view the mountain from a distance: 1-3 nothing, 4-8 minor tremors, 9-11 distressing smoldering, 12 eruption. The lava flow will head Northeast to the sea, through hexes [[0512]] and [[0612]]. After the eruption, the lopsided face of the volcano looks strangely like the profile of a lost dwarven king.

author: John Carr
description: Termite mounds hundreds, even thousands of feet high

author: Ben Djarum
description: The small village of Lenina. A blacksmith's son has become possessed by an evil spirit. He is bound in shackles and locked away in an old barn. At night he cries out the names of the villagers and the dates and ways in which they will die.

author: John Carr
description: These hills have eyes: a beholder spawning site just beneath the surface

author: Patrick Henry Downs
description: A smoldering campfire that appears to have exhausted it's fuel within the last day. A small opened belt pouch sits in the middle of three charred bodies lying fifteen feet to the east of the fire pit.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: Abandoned silver mine. D10 Kobolds.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: 2d10 Chaotic pilgrims cruising for sick thrills. Led by The Devil Himself, a third-level cleric.

author: Richard Rush
description: An angry mother bear rages because her cub has been caught in a trap.

author: Ben Djarum
description: Three escaped refugees from the Oakheart Academy [[0304]] are hiding in the trees on this rocky plateau. They are being menaced by a pack of 8 grizzly bears.

author: Zak Smith
description: Pile of slain deodands--same tribe as those in [[0418]], apparently slain by the amazon in [[0419]].

author: Casey Garske
description: Moonlight shining through the Needle from [[0321]] illuminates the Moon Goddess's temple on this mountainside.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: Weeping statue looks towards sister on peak of [[0816]]. If their gazes are aligned, a chasm will open at [[0618]] leading to lost city.

author: Jacob Hurst
description: Large demon stands before a bridgeless chasm. Compelled to aid those who wish to cross, but acts aggressively in the hopes of triggering combat and slaying or being slain (reappears in 24 hours) so he doesn't have to help.

author: Ben Djarum
description: A cenotaph covered in choking vines of ivy. Hidden within the vines is an entrance to a dungeon beneath.

author: Ray Colina
description: ROPETOWN, most who live in this town either grow hemp, or make rope. The town headman, Mangai, will pay 500 gp, for the return of his feckless son, Lein the Ropesmoker, who ran off to be one of the sea hippies in hex [[0502]].

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: Treacherous path, 60% chance of blizzard. 8 wolves.

author: Olman Feelyus
description: Beautiful alpine lake, crystal clear, cold, excellent for drinking, washing and fishing.

author: Jack Mcnamee
description: 20 Nomadic hill people.

author: M Nicksic
description: Mastodon graveyard, reverently avoided by nomadic tribes. Disturbing remains has a 60% chance of angering a random God with Animal/Nature/Mastodon portfolio.

author: Trent B
description: Travelling Minstrels! Currently composing a ballad about the contents of hex (D20) (D20+6)

author: Ray Colina
description: A grove of tall trees has 2-24 giant bees.

author: Anthony Picaro
description: No animal found on this forested peninsula has any teeth, each choking down their food whole. Otherwise healthy.

author: Ben Djarum
description: Suicide Cult of Moon Elves are gathered in a circle of stones, awaiting a meteor to streak across the sky.

author: Ray Colina
description: Flotsam. If night, the strange mournful calls of some unknown sea creature.

author: M Nicksic
description: The shipping channel is filled with d20 mines from some long ago war. These masterwork mines are all crafted to resemble eye tyrants, and each has a 1 in 6 chance of still being active.

author: Eric Boyd
description: Haunted salt marsh/tide flats- basically a group of small islands at high tide. On arrival and every 30 minutes, roll a d8: if 1, a ghost; 2-3. a of 3d4 sea-ghouls in ancient rotted soldier's uniforms

author: Ray Colina
description: Half sunk into the black waters of this fetid swamp is the Iron Tower of the Space Vampire. Giant frogs, apparently not bothered by the cold, are common here.

author: Ben Djarum
description: Abandoned lighthouse

author: Ray Colina
description: The tribesmen here fish from dugout canoes. They tend to a dying sailor from [[VEKTH]] [[0209]]. Hidden in his dagger’s scabbard is a map to the dungeon in hex [[0522]].

author: Zak Smith
description: Small island temple surrounded by a flotilla of miniature wooden boats. Worshippers come here and place messages to the Gods of the Chrysanthemum Sea in these boats and wait for the tide to take them and interfering with one has a 5% chance of bringing a water-breathing-only curse down on the blasphemer.

author: Zak Smith
description: DASTREICH VALE  Hyrax Vooreal and his 20 werewolf minions rules this fortified island city, sacrificing those who displease him to the Goddess of the Gibbous Moon.

author: Zak Smith
description: Palace of 1000 Terraces (Island Castle) Originally built 1000 years ago as a summer estate for the NegaTsar, it contains overgrown gardens, winding stairs, chimes, parlors. It was so beautiful, the NegaTsar used to have everyone who saw it drowned.

author: Ray Colina
description: A squat lonely tower is home to Dagan Zur the Transmuter, wizard and avid entomologist. Dagan Zur spends hours each day scrying with his crystal ball for new insects to study and catalog. He has secretly fallen in love with the Mosquito Queen [[0127]] and will seek to punish any who bring harm to her.

author: Zak Smith
description: The Pool of Heal and Harm: In the daylight the pool is red. Anyone getting in the pool takes 2d12 points of damage. At night the pool is clear blue. Anyone getting into the pool heals 2d12 hits. (stolen from Majestic Wilderlands)

author: Ray Colina
description: Atop a flat-topped hill is the decapitated head of a statue, some fourteen feet tall on its side. It depicts the face of a gaping fish-man.

author: Ben Djarum
description: Battle Arena of Ras Rachtan - A colossal, oval-shaped arena filled with giant stone statues called The Rachtan. By using a series of spells and controls, one can animate the Rachtan to battle one another. Rachtan betting is serious business.

author: Zak Smith
description: Grigs and pixies turned hostile by Dagan Zur in [[0621]] in a black tree that grows sideways. Their treasure includes 9000gp, a land deed to Vornheim and a mangled taxidermized miniphant that contains a small die which is actually a lich's phylactery.

author: Jensan Thuresson
description: Pack of undead birds.

author: Trent B
description: Wild Boar, an abandoned homestead and an overgrown orchard, claimed by the wild.

author: Justin Howe
description: Group of statues in various hostile poses that are actually adventurers that were turned to stone by long dead basilisk.

author: Ray Colina
description: The 36 tribesman who live in these hills are actually wereboars. They are forced to give tribute to  Hyrax Vooreal [[0610]] and are bound from attacking him directly. They seek proxies to relieve them of this burden.

author: Rob Acton
description: Blasted craggy hills that have been sculpted by the NE wind into the shapes of the totems of the Argui Tribe.

author: Trent B
description: Dwarven Skeletons patrol here at night. Any severed skeleton pieces will attempt to crawl back to the entrance to the subterranean dwarf skeleton dungeon with treasure and curses and tragedy.

author: Zak Smith
description: Giant Flail Snail--20' tall. Shell is worth 10x normal price.

author: Ray Colina
description: GAGORUM the Nomad City is made up of scores of ancient stone houses and other buildings, each made from a solid piece of an unknown green stone. It is a ghost-town most of the year, but during the winter months the nomadic tribes of the region gather for a great moot.

author: Trent B
description: Fishing Hamlet - Fish the shores of the lake in [[0723]]. A  certain type of Lake Squid has fine fibres, which are used to make luxurious, soft and strong clothing here.

author: Zak Smith
description: Castle Abatte: Abatte is a petty warlord he employs the best chefs in the realm. Obliging when he wants something--will pay 10x the price for exotic ingredients or spices.

author: Reece Carter
description: dark deep forests, nothing special in here, just scary darkness

author: Reece Carter
description: more dark deep forests, but here there be spiders, trap door spiders and goldern orb spiders (but medium-large sized)

author: Ray Colina
description: Within a massive termite mound like structure lives a Bee Demon. It trades its demon-honey, valued for its endurance enhancing properties, for betrayed confidences and broken promises.

author: Zak Smith
description: A single large snow leopard lives here, it is sacred to the moon elves who live here ( 06 02 ) and is the only animal in the area with teeth.

author: Reece Carter
description: this area is prone to rip tides, they are very strong and very long

author: Ian Burns
description: Remains of a prehistoric shark lie of the sea floor.

author: Zak Smith
description: Hyperintelligent monkeys from [[0505]] are posing as ordinary pets and plan to take over the merchant vessel--The Dawn Bream--moored at the island here.

author: Ian Burns
description: Small village of 61 honorable fisherman constructed of 12 large, wooden rafts banded together and floating at sea.

author: Zak Smith
description: 3 Intelligent foxes hunt the marsh. All know Suggestion . They trapped the princess in [[0707]].

The princess trapped in a magical island gibbet here can enslave the minds of men for 24 hours at a time, but can only be freed speaking the ancient spell written into the sigils of the fish in 01 22.

author: Ian Burns
description: Cliff-side monastery of 23 blind elves that nontheless fight a 6th level fighters dedicated to the appeasement of the Lurker of Endless Night. 1d20 x 1d20 GP worth of valuables within.

author: Zak Smith
description: WROTHWHEEL (settlement) Baron Cytorrak, who rules here, is cruel but respects the Gods of the Chrysanthemum Sea [[0609]]. The prayers in his devotion vessels contain clues to his intrigues with Abatte [[0624]] and the wizard in [[0411]] .

author: M Nicksic
description: The unusually clear water reveals a vast sponge field. Ingesting the sponges causes nausea and strange visions which allow the eater to see the future as if the had cast Augury.

author: M Nicksic
description: A small fishing village has grown wealthy catering to a strange sect of deathwish pilgrims who travel to see the palace in [[0611]] knowing they will be put to death by the NegaTsar.

author: Zak Smith
description: A statue of the Bringer of Endless Night is sunk beneath the water here. It is sacred to the Ixitachitl in [[0503]].

author: Ian Burns
description: Sixteen greedy dwarves hopelessly pan the many rivers and streams in this hex for gold.

author: Zak Smith
description: Inside a sturdy watchtower is what appears to be a statue of an elf looking in the sky to the east. It was the first intelligent creature to discover that the reclusive dragon roosting in the peaks at [[1413]] is actually a dracolisk.

author: Zak Smith
description: Ancient elven burial city now occupied by a necromancer. She is served by a disturbing variety of undead birds (ghoul crows, skeletal vultures, bloodfalcons etc)--including those in [[0617]].

author: Ian Burns
description: Remains of an ancient battle between Elven and Goblins kind. Followers of the Many Headed God morn this sight.

author: Reece Carter
description: here is the caves of the goblin heroes, it has many a valuable item in here, and the goblins who live here fight as a 3-4 level rogue and 2-3 level fighter (multi-class)

author: Zak Smith
description: Vyrvalis (settlement) this was once an enormous elven city made entirely of geometrically carved white marble with circular openings for doors. Now it is mostly overgrown and supports a small population of traders and hunters.

author: Ian Burns
description: Seven giant hogs branded in the left buttocks.

author: M Nicksic
description: d20 Rabid monkeys hiding in the trees pelt intruders mercilessly with extremely hard nuts (treat as slingshot) and will attempt to steal small, shiny objects during the night from people foolish enough to camp here.

author: Zak Smith
description: Dwarves hunting wereboars [[0619]] through the ruins of a vast temple complex that used to be adjacent to Vyrvalis [[0117]].

author: Anders Nordberg
description: Camp of the Dwarven expedition searching for clues to the secrets of Vervalis [[0117]] in the nearby Dwarf Skeleton Dungeon [[0620]]. Most are hunting boars in the nearby forest [[0720]].

author: M Nicksic
description: At the junction of two major trade routes, a low, rambling inn does a brisk business selling barbecued pork to travelers. They will grill anything for the right price.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: A shallow lake completely fills this grim valley. The water is murky, almost black with silt and infested with giant eels.

author: Mike Evans
description: A group of twenty two statues of ugly haggard woman that face away from one another, circled around carving of full moon.  Babbling and nonsensical mutterings are heard passing between them.  When the moon is full the statues face each other and sing warnings of [[0416]].

author: Jeff Rients
description: Stankbog, muddy human village of 150 wretches that worship the Great Swamp Gas, a nearby Will-o-Wisp.

author: Mike Evans
description: Mountain man lives in rickety cabin.  Practices taxidermy and talks to his stuffed animals, hoping one day they'll talk back.

author: Chris Blauwkamp
description: A statue of a okapi stands alone. It is disturbingly realistic.

author: M Nicksic
description: A herd of mastodons are escorting their dying matriarch to the graveyard at 05 26. D6+2 nomadic tribesmen are observing and will attempt to thwart anyone interfering with the procession.

author: August Aronsson
description: Iceberg adrift, with ruined camp of gnomish polar explorers, inexplicably killed.

author: Thomas Fitzgerald
description: Empty coracle floats alone

author: Ray Colina
description: A hopelessly lost flotilla of small vessels, pilgrims from [[VEKTH]] [[0209]] seeking the island temple in [[0609]]. They will ask the Gods of the Chrysanthemum Sea to smile upon any who set them back on course.

author: Ray Colina
description: The trees in these woods make fine dugout canoes. Two tribes live here, one of them practices ritual cannibalism.

author: August Aronsson
description: Isolated community of ex-sailors only admits settlers who are afflicted by scurvy. Fresh fruit is confiscated by the authorities.

author: Matthew Burack
description: A fishing boat carrying a salty ex-soldier turned fisherman, a young scholar, and a paladin. They are hunting a giant devil-shark.

author: Matt Maranda
description: the wreckage of 5 ancient longboats can be found here. They hold a treasure guarded by the restless spirits of ship crews.

author: Brendan S
description: Placid waters, an area frequently plied by pleasure barges of decadent nobles (guarded by heavily armored janissarys). They will sometimes pay adventurers to engage in gladiatorial combat.

author: Ray Colina
description: The burial mounds here hold the most honored dead of local nomadic tribes. One of the mounds has recently been broken into or out of, whatever was inside is gone.

author: Matthew Burack
description: A hamster in a magic sphere slowly rolls his way across the landscape. The hamster needs no water, food, or air and is completely immune to all harm while the globe is intact.

author: Ray Colina
description: The cloaked figure sailing a skiff is actually the powerful skeleton, Zox (7HD, claws, fires green magic missiles from its emerald eyes). Every year, his mistress, the necromancer in [[0715]], sends him to gather magic mushrooms that grow in [[0711]], this year the mushrooms were gone, taken by the sea hippies in [[0502]]. Fearful of returning empty handed, he demands any vessel he comes across allow him to search their ship, attacking if he is refused.

author: Joey Lindsey
description: Dense overgrowth along the bank hides a cave entrance. Inside the cave, the path West is a dungeon where undead dwarves toil fruitlessly; the other exit is in [[0406]]. The underground path East has a track and ancient mining cart, with an eventual opening to an owlbear cave in [[1312]].

author: Darien Mason
description: a leprechaun guards his pot of gold. He has health issues and will pay handsomely for a sack of prunes/

author: Ray Colina
description: A party of 2-8 Ice Trolls hunt here, amongst their possessions is a tattered map written in a forgotten language. It details how to use “The Needle” in [[0321]].

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Golem Factory: Crafter hos gone mad and created a sentient flesh golem that has taken over his factory. It is turning everything suitable into golems (including but not limited to: the entire contents of the crafters treasury, obsidian decor, the pantry, the bedroom linens etc.) The flesh golem has an extremely long, six-jointed arm and 3 heads. It desires to have its creator's face sown onto it.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Paranoid man living in a gazebo. He has a bone scalpel that protects him from anyone whose name he carves in his skin.

author: Ray Colina
description: DAMNATION a sprawling ramshackle boom-town of tents and rickety lean-tos has sprung up in a windy valley here after the discovery of mega-dungeon. It is wretched hive of scum and villainy nearly as dangerous as the dungeon itself. Recently, unknown arsonists have taken to setting fires in order to loot in the wake of the chaos.

author: Matt Maranda
description: These plains contain several cairns spread in a circular formation over  a 4 mile radius. At the center is a very large barrow with a low entry.  Deep bellow the barrow lies a helmet sized to fit in the throne of hex [[0119]] and is capable of making sense of the visual panoply present there.

author: Darien Mason
description: A pair of manticores are cursed to guard an orchard of plum trees. Any vegetation they try to eat shrivels in their paws.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Pastel colored lime pit

author: Joey Lindsey
description: Thin stretch of forest with poison ivy, mosquitos, dragonflies, songbirds.

author: Matt Maranda
description: At the edge of the forest and guarding the plains is the fort and trading town of Axerist.

author: Ray Colina
description: Shaggy wild horses run through these plains, if captured and broken, they will make fine mounts.

author: Joey Lindsey
description: An exceedingly shy Dryad lives in this sparse copse. She is feral, possibly rabid, and feeds on the eels from the lake in [[0723]]. The local animals are afraid of her.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Pugnacious clan of hill giants walk around with black eyes and bruises from their incessant squabbling, subsist on diet almost entirely of giant eels from [[0723]]. They dress in skin-tight eel skin leggings, sport eel tooth jewelry, smell like eels and are actually quite slippery.

author: Darien Mason
description: The secret t' cookin' giant eels, y'see, is y'gotta put 'm in a tub and feed 'm loaves of bread for a couple weeks t' clean 'm out. Then they's delicious!

author: Zak Smith
description: Was once an office of the local taxation department of the NegaTsar, now in ruins. Contains a hidden vault containing 4500gp, reams of documents with the suspected locations of various ancient potentates' hidden treasure, and the descendants of a pack of  wolfdogs the tax collector bred to protect him on his travels.

author: Zak Smith
description: Corpse of a hill giant from [[0823]] ripped apart by wild dogs from [[0824]]. Has 345gp, 2-handed sword (a sword to him), and clear footprints leading from the north.

author: Zak Smith
description: Cathedral of an ancient insect cult related to the Mosquito Queen in [[0127]]. It and the tunnels beneath are in the process of being sacked by goblins who are fighting huge walking wasps in the tunnels. Some of the goblins have begun to develop strangely faceted eyes and wasplike legs.

author: Casey Garske
description: An apatosaurus corpse is being scavenged by a pack of deinonychus.

author: Joshua Macy
description: Ancient monolith.  The shadow of the monolith will teleport anyone standing fully within it 1d6 hexes in the direction its currently pointing, as long as that's not off the edge of the map (due to the lay of the land it casts no shadow in directions that would be off the map).

author: Zak Smith
description: NYNGLOOM CASTLE Surrounded by hundreds of ships beached after a tide-lowering spell cast during a catastrophic war. Infested with carrion crawlers.

author: Chris Blauwkamp
description: FELLMOUNT ABBEY An abbey of monks sits in these hills, brewing beer. 20 years ago, the monks were replaced by dopplegangers, who continue to brew quite good beer.

author: Matt Maranda
description: A sinkhole 3 miles long, over 200' feet across at its widest and incredibly deep scars the land here. The air around it smells of methane.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Procession of bat-like methane-breathers from [[0903]], fleeing some terror worse than death from deep below, all collapsed in a heap. They need concentrated methane fast!

author: Alex Williamson
description: A great tree dominates a clearing here. Its upper branches are home to a nest of benevolent but mischievous couatls.

author: Casey Garske
description: Kleptomaniacal monkeys bring their ill-gotten gains to the coatls in [[0905]]. The coatls may ask a favor to have the items returned.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Waters teeming with millions of luminous jellyfish including one colossal telepathic jellyfish oracle who will answer any question with 100% accuracy for a single human sacrifice.

author: Simon Forster
description: in the ruins of a castle are a dozen bronze-soldiers, automatons that march and fight when military-styled music is played.

author: Ben Djarum
description: the petrified remains of a colossal whale. The bones and ossified digestive tract of the creature has created a vast labyrinthine system of passages.

author: Asen R Georgiev
description: A city amidst swamps, that blocks the safest route through the treacherous ground. It takes a tax of 5% on any valuables one wants to bring through it, not just trade goods.

author: Casey Garske
description: Ghouls live under the ancient battlefield here. The ghoul king wields the sword of an ancient prince who died on the battlefield.

author: Joey Lindsey
description: This expanse gets rockier to the south, and the shore with [[0911]] is one large flat stone expanse. Huge Lizards come here to bask in the sun and drink the water. Zox from [[0810]] feeds people he kills to them, and random items litter the ground and shallows.

author: James Smith
description: Small town, recently razed because its inhabitants worshiped the FF Elemental Princes. Patrol of 30 soldiers from [[0909]] is hunting for survivors and putting them to the sword.

author: Ray Colina
description: Relatively shallower waters make this a feeding ground for sea life including 2-24 Crabmen.

author: Ray Colina
description: Not far from the shore, hidden under branches and brambles is a longboat. At first glance it appears a to be Viking vessel but closer inspection reveals it to be of White Elf construction.

author: Zak Smith
description: Ancient pile of boar and snow leopard bones. Digging beneath for an hour reveals a plinth of depthless black stone that may account for all the preternaturally smart monkeys on this hex map.

author: Casey Garske
description: The fossilized jaws of a Tyrannosaurus jut from the bare rock here. A warrior praying within the jaws is granted a +1 to attack and damage while within the surrounding hexes.

author: Zak Smith
description: Armored chaos champions on metallic steeds roam this area, obeying ancient orders to defend the overgrown and partially buried skull-shaped temple. The necromancer in [[0715]] seeks this hidden temple as it is holds the key to the energies responsible for all the undead on this hexmap.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: A prosperous vineyard run by retired halfling adventures.

author: Shaine Edwards
description: A family of Halfling moonshiners ride an enormous tortoise. Their assortment of cheap liquors has made for strained relations with the vintners in hex 09 15.

author: Ray Colina
description: A party of 8 White Elves in warmasks and their half-ogre slave pulling cart as they return from the dungeon in [[0816]], they are in route to their ship in [[0912]]. Inside the cart is 8000 gp in tapestries, candlesticks, offertory containers, oils, and idols, all of them of them of fine make and bearing snake motifs. There is also a beautiful green skinned female in a glass coffin; she wears snake themed jewelry and little else.

author: Zak Smith
description: A feast set for a king lies exposed to the elements but unperturbed. The tablecloth and chair cushions are a spongy moss--anyone eating it is cursed to guard the plum orchard in [[0817]].

author: Matthew Burack
description: A gnomish survey team and their clockwork servants/guards have staked out the corners of this hex and are in the process of creating a detailed map of the area that they refer to as "Sector Oh Nine One Nine". Their base camp is near a set of ancient standing stones in a hexagonal ring around a hexagonal altar in the exact center of the area they are surveying.

author: Matt Maranda
description: A lake in grassland with several abandoned huts on its shores. The horses of [[0821]] and the shepherds from [[0820]] sometime pasture near it.

author: Mike Evans
description: A field of knee high grass that is razor sharp that works its way into the wounds of those who are cut, infecting the host.  When rolled up and smoked can see through time.

author: Zak Smith
description: Pair of settlements in the forest: SKYVVEN-human and SEEKERSFILE--elven. Both are hospitable.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: A ring of great standing stones carved from bright orange quartz sits on a hill. Beneath the altar is the entrance to a labyrinth which lies below the hill. Infested with crypt ghasts the maze is also home to seven magic sacrificial daggers made from the same orange quartz.

author: Shaine Edwards
description: A sickly forest hides the entrance to Oozopolis, an abandoned subterranean town now haunted by slimes. A pair of Druids investigate.

author: Ben Djarum
description: a sad satyr sits here playing a sad song on a silver sitar. He takes requests and will give those who appreciate his music a small copper key.

author: Alex Williamson
description: A constant bubbling near the shore here belies an underground spring which connects to a flooded cave system. If followed for 2 miles the caves rise above the water line and connect to the labyrinth in [[0923]].

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Goblin-built Wooden Submarine -- More or less sea-wothy

author: Joey Lindsey
description: A massive hollowed-out insect head at the bottom of the lake. If one swims into the left eye, violently rushing water takes you through tunnels, eventually emerging in [[1226]]. Bits of flesh and dark liquids eddy above the right eye; anyone swimming inside is wracked with pain and gains insectoid mutations.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Hidden shed contains wooden torpedoes for the submarine in [[0926]]. Over time they sweat nitroglycerine and are highly unstable

author: Wayne Snyder
description: In the center of this dark forest, a band of surly orks run a lumber mill powered by giant rats running in huge wooden wheels.

author: Zak Smith
description: Pile of recently deceased adventurers and wolves that slew each other after the adventurers visited Nyngloom Castle and Fellmount Abbey (hexes [[0901]] [[0902]] ) and the dwarven camp [[0721]]. They have extensive gear, notes and maps.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Gnomish Junkyard. Pretty much anything made out of metal, glass, wood or stone can be found here, only catch is that whenever you find something you want, the gnomes suddenly remember they need that exact part for something very important.

author: Zak Smith
description: A child that can't speak but merely croak like a frog. A crawling hand the size of a house.

author: Zak Smith
description: Large pond contains a giant teakettle wherein dwells Chleresta the Lazy Witch--responsible for freaks in [[1003]]. She forgot some important shoes when she moved from [[0103]] and will attempt to convince/force visitors to retrieve them.

author: Matt Maranda
description: A tower in the woods manned by elves; guard a well said to give the imbiber greater insight to the doings of the gods.

author: Chris Blauwkamp
description: A thatched hut with seven brothers, seeking seven brides. The brothers are ogre magi.

author: Joey Lindsey
description: A small band of heavily wounded survivors of tribal warfare to the south and east. They seek protectors for their pregnant leader, whose child they believe will unite the tribes in adulthood. The Wizard in [[0411]] owes them a favor, as does the Amazon in [[0419]].

author: Zak Smith
description: Large wardrum in a crumbling tower. If played it will cause the constructs in [[0908]] to attack the ghouls in [[0909]].

author: Joey Lindsey
description: a war party of hill tribesmen, chasing the small band in [[1007]]. They expect their quarry to seek out the Ogre Magi, and are armed for them - Periapts of True Seeing, herbal unguent that works like napalm, and a shaman with Dispel Magic.

author: Zak Smith
description: Princess Adria and her retinue are going to visit her sister--sent here months ago to marry (and enslave) one of the ogre mages [[1006]]. Unbeknownst to Adria or the angry ogres, her sister never made it to the wedding because she is trapped in [[0707]] .

author: Ray Colina
description: The cairns in these plains hold the most honored dead of nomadic tribes. One of the mounds has recently been broken into or out of, whatever was inside is gone.

author: Duncan Young
description: The corpse of a giant, buried in undergrowth but showing no signs if decay or consumption. An orchard with a sign reading "Keep out! No scrumping! Trespassers will be pulped!"

author: Humza Kazmi
description: The orc tribe here are all Terminator-2 liquid-shimmery-metal (AC improved by 2, weapons out of hands). The trees in this forest are also all different types of metal, with a giant pool of mercury at the heart of the forest.

author: Wayne Snyder
description: This forest grows thick with razor weed, poison humbert, stinging ghost leaf and strangle wort. Travel rates through this area are reduced by 75%.

author: Zak Smith
description: DIES ARKATT (settlement) Two colossal statues (? or victims of the Dracolisk in [[1413]]) of ancient gods crashed together long ago here but remain essentially vertical. A largely vertical settlement has grown up on and around them.

author: Courtney Campbell
description: A geomancer sits by the side of the road, depressed over fighting with his wife. His wife is a naga paladin. There is a hobgoblin witch nearby that creates twig demons to disrupt their relationship.

author: Thomas Fitzgerald
description: Vriminynthe Gholthaniel: Elvish lancer, banished vassal of Baron Cytorrak [[0709]], rides a feathered tyrannosaur, seeks adventure.

author: Edgar Johnson
description: Glen of Howling Trees. This haunted wood shelters a variety of ghosts.

author: Joey Lindsey
description: Crkt Bibin, a dense growth of trees home to a secret city of hundreds of murderous bandits. If a bag of 50 GP per traveller is left at the proper spot, the bandits will leave you alone. If you were well-liked in DIES ARKATT [[1014]], they will have told you of the "Crkt Bibin Tax".

author: Zak Smith
description: The nagas in [[0322]] and [[0121]] worship this statue of Mistress of All Perils. The geomancer's wife [[1014]] seeks its destruction but her grotesque appearance makes it difficult for her to recruit aid so she has recently taken to wearing a shell of ornate humanoid plate armor fixed to a horse to hide her wormlike body.

author: Richard G
description: the hills have many small rockpools. One pool, limpid blue, acts as a one-way teleporter to hex [[0310]].

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: 5' wide shaft, impossibly deep.

author: Richard G
description: 3d20 goats. If disturbed they stampede, screaming, into adjacent grassland hexes.

author: Richard Rush
description: An enormous constrictor is noisily giving birth... to small-sized, fully-grown people. They're mentally infantile, and lack belly buttons.

author: Ray Colina
description: Akerbeltz, the dancing hill demon, a twelve foot tall goat-spirit with adamantine horns, has made this rugged terrain his home. He either attacks or offers to answer a question, 50/50 chance. He can summon 3-36 goats from [[1020]].

author: Richard G
description: a tree with carnivorous roots and fruits. The fruit are delicious and nutritious but if stored in packs they'll eat all the rest of your food and if eaten they cause 1d6 damage 1d6 hours after eating.

author: Richard G
description: a deep gorge with trees growing horizontally out of the sides, forming a living jungle gym. Inhabited by climbing, sociable, talkative monkey con-artists.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Undead greenskeepers tend acre after acre of impeccably tidy lawns, gardens, manicured shrubberies, decorative arrangements of stones, water features, etc. They work ceaselessly, expanding their project in all directions, pausing only to destroy those who would impede their progress .

author: Dave Younce
description: There is a 50' wide unfinished stone-lined canal running NE/SW here; the apparently dwarven engineering work to connect the lake at [[0926]] with the one at [[1125]] was about halfway complete when work stopped (the oldest dwarf in [[UPSIDE]] [[0114]] was a digger here as a boy and can tell wild stories about it for the price of a pint of ale). It is now overgrown with vines and home only to a few giant frogs with delicious flesh and faintly glowing eyes.

author: Ray Colina
description: Angerboda, Witch of the Iron Wood, a giantess-witch, lives here with 2d12 ogres. The nuns of the Oakheart Academy in [[0305]] mocked her and have made a lifelong enemy. Abatte in [[0624]] owes her a favor, for the dark blessing she preformed for his son.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Tribe of Gorilla-Men, hates all monkeys, especially he intelligent ones. The position of village chief can be contested through one-on-one melee combat followed by a game of chess. Current leader wields a +2 monkeybane club.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: A party of vicious barbarian heroes make their way north, to smite the Mistress of All Perils (hex [[1017]]) at the behest of their vision-beset shaman, who also told them to befriend a worm-woman. Very friendly to any who openly blaspheme against the Mistress.

author: Zak Smith
description: Village of Morons. The black plinth in [[0913]] awakens monkeys by trading parts of their consciousness with that of nearby humans, many of these unfortunate idiots have gathered here for some reason.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Scattered crappy campsites of the Half-morons. They have no idea why they are here, but enjoy sticking it to the Morons of [[1101]] at every opportunity.

author: Richard G
description: gigantic smoking cone looks more like a factory chimney than a volcano. The smoke slows thinking and causes confusion, but is strangely addictive.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Sage religiously writes down anything ever said to him directly. Travels in a wagon filled to the brim with tomes he has written.

author: Richard G
description: sandbars extend from shore forming a causeway to [[1205]] for the hour of lowest tide. Morons from [[1101]] frequently get trapped by the incoming tide, to the enormous but silent amusement of the snails.

author: Richard G
description: The witch from [[0103]], clamped like a limpet onto the back of the butcher from [[0408]], sculling SE with a long spoon. The butcher is floating, face just out of the water, weeping softly. If left uninterrupted they will eventually get to the island at [[1805]], where the witch will sacrifice the butcher to summon an earthquake carp.

author: Jason Sholtis
description: Seared debris floats around, all that remains of a sorcerer's experimental ironclad warship that violently exploded on its maiden voyage, killing the sorcerer and most of her minions. Her secret harbor and research facility (now unmanned but for undead cleaning crew) remains concealed by illusion on the shores of  hex [[1108]].

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Portal to the fae realm, heavily guarded by the crimson faerie court. 90% chance to encounter a reception committee of 3d4 fierce redcap guardians.

author: Taar Koth
description: Pattern of carved stones surrounding altar. Wereboar preparing for a ritual to sacrifice himself to achieve apotheosis.

author: Niles Calder
description: On moonless nights a coven of witches celebrate their dark rites. Witnesses must save versus spells or be sucked into their merry making, becoming willing subjects to whatever they do which could be fun but naughty, but probably isn't. Those who pass their saves are pursued by dark forces (Phantasmal Killer each) for 1d6 hexes, or until dawn, which ever comes first. 13 Witches, MU level 2d6.

author: Zak Smith
description: Twisted treants dwell here, moaning in the north wind. They mutilate visitors and drop the pieces down a well full of white insects.

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Burial mounds of the eleven kings, secured by powerful magic. The shaman in [[1009]] knows how to open them, but demands a big sacrifice for the information. The precious grave goods are protected by sophisticated traps.

author: James Young
description: A wolf, apparently ordinary. When damaged an entire other wolf jumps out of its mouth, and so on.

author: Reece Carter
description: a large cave opening is here, it extends about 50m back and is about 10-15m tall. Its really nothing, just good protection against the elements

author: Reece Carter
description: goblin cavelry are here, they are riding on some form of mountain goat. The goblins count as 3rd level fighters, the mountain goats count as a war horse, 1D3 per party member will attack

author: Trent B
description: ancient tower on the hillside, overlooks the grasslands to the south. Table inside is a carved stone map of the mountains northwest.

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Strawberry fields. In the village of Forehome, any valuable goods can be traded for delicious strawberries. The local priest controls a powerful stone golem who is sent to deal with strawberry thieves.

author: Trent B
description: SHALLOWGROVE. Squalid settlement of 49 human outcasts. Send criminals and ill people to the howling glen in [[1016]].

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Goblin and/or Monkey desperately clinging on to giant silken balloon floating 100 ft in the air. Will shout offers of a magic ring as reward for getting it down safely.

author: James Young
description: Jagged, close-set pines make this hex annoying to move through.

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: Old meteor impact crater. Lucky prospectors might find meteor splinters.

author: Trent B
description: A dark, misty swamp surrounds a murky spring and its accompanying treasure-having Temple Of Leeches. Disease bearing leech hybrid swamp creatures hound every step and a cult of 9 leech-headed men, elves and dwarves attempt to magically spread the leeches corrupting influence beyond the swamp temple.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Naked gnome convinced he is in fact invisible. Cannot be convinced otherwise and does not respond to logic.

author: James Raggi
description: A confused, distracted, (immediately) forgetful old hermit lives atop the mountain here who thinks any visitors are his kids and grandkids and serves them his mountain goat stew. He owns a map of the region that makes it twice as likely to become lost (disregard roads and rivers when determining this, using the surrounding terrain) and if the PCs become lost, the map rewrites the surrounding land so that whatever direction the PCs go, where they thought they were going is there instead of where it should be.

author: Zak Smith
description: THISTLETHRALL (settlement) the Elves here dissolve the those who bore them in acidic pits.

author: Jürgen Mayer
description: An earth elemental is looking for victims to sacrifice to the God of Dirt. Neutral clerics may have a chance to reason with it.

author: Gus L
description: HELVIZ'S FOLLY - Town of 36 souls, but with neat brick buildings for several hundred more residents.

author: Richard Rush
description: A band of marauders who raid nearby areas mounted on armored hippopotami make their camp on a small island in the middle of this lake. Magical amphorae keep their animals hydrated when they range beyond its shores.

author: Trent B
description: Thick forest contains various fungus, some edible, some poisonous. Some (1 in 6, if chosen randomly) turn eater into a myconid/fungusman in D6 days (con save)

author: Trent B
description: SUNNYHILL - settlement. A hillside of 260 halflings, (relatively) recently moved here from [[1220]] because the cruel leeches in [[1120]] kept stealing children. Leeches and, more recently, fungus are explicitly illegal. Possession punishable by mutilation.

author: Zak Smith
description: NINE NEERING (settlement) Lord Frast is generous and obliging, but his disturbed halfling clown seeks to supplant him and feed him to the apes in [[1026]].

author: Reece Carter
description: There is something special hidden deep in the forest here, but its protected by the forest itself. The forest paths will change, the trees will attack, the random animals will ambush and then lead the party astray, even the weather doesnt want it found. What it is? No one knows

author: Zak Smith
description: A princess heads south with her retinue to marry one of the ogre mages in [[1006]]. She is a weretiger and preys on the nearby idiots in [[1101]] and [[1102]].

author: Reece Carter
description: water elementals are attacking at the sheer cliff faces along the edge of the hex trying to make their way into [[1201]].

author: Steve Sigety
description: Corpse of a pirate strapped to a barrel with steel chains -- a warning to other mutineers. The barrel is full of gunpowder.

author: Trent B
description: An abandoned barge. Some supplies, no treasure.

author: Martin Bay Thomsen
description: Gorgon-Minotaurs chariot racing in marble arena.

author: Trent B
description: The support upright remains of a six mile bridge running north south.

author: Trent B
description: On the shore near the remains of the bridge, someones long abandoned equipment lays against a tree, wrapped in a waterproof cloak. 55 gp, adventure gear, sword, writing material and a footnoted book on dwarven construction methods.

author: Trent B
description: A tribe of aloof humans, involved in the tribal warfare in [[1007]]. They are clad in newly made leech masks and dark, segmented cloaks. They appear to be preparing for an expedition.

author: Matt Maranda
description: The woods are inhabited by Dryads that hide from the savages of [[1208]] and created the worm to keep them distracted. They would gladly pay with healing and the bounty of the forest if anyone could depose the witches from [[1109]].

author: Zak Smith
description: GREASEGRAFT friendly, usually quiet settlement. Nearby: a fortress inhabited by goblins wearing iron warmasks.

author: Claytonian JP
description: a gigantic, though fairly innocuous, armored worm. The worm passes through everything like a ghost and feeds on auras.

author: Brian Green
description: Contains a hidden gargantuan trapdoor spider lair.  Lair is inhabited by a tribe of primitive desert elves who slew the spider generations ago.

author: Trent B
description: A giant, silver-black owl, 7HD, stalks these mountains at night, feeding on anything smaller than a horse. It attempts to drag larger prey off cliffs and there is decent treasure in its lair.

author: Matt Maranda
description: The Keep Bael Beauty, is a strong well supplied castle. All who attend Bael are beautiful and it is said the lord himself is so gorgeous that his stare can turn others into his servants.

author: Ray Colina
description: Halflings from [[GALASSA]] [[0315]] struggle with an exceptionally beautiful shaggy horse, from of the herd in [[0821]]. They plan to take the horse back to [[0316]] to be sacrificed. The horse is an exceptional animal, worthy of being a Paladin's mount if rescued; if no suitable paladin is present it will return to its herd.

author: Reece Carter
description: a open grassy planes, nothing special to see here, in fact to spot something you roll at +2. Roll on a wondering monster table

author: Trent B
description: An abandoned iron mine and settlement. A mile in, the mine breaks into a vast mile deep cavern.

author: Random Wizard
description: Self flagellating deathwish pilgrims are wandering lost here. They will offer what meager coin they have for directions to the town at [[0711]] but will attempt to kidnap the weak and unwary as offering for their death god.

author: Stuart Marshall
description: Forest.  Treant is under a curse and has 1d4 golden apples growing from its branches, picking them is extremely painful for it.

author: Steve Sigety
description: A tribe of peaceful centaurs make their home in the woods. They warn travelers about the archanotech-mummies in hex [[1317]].

author: Trent B
description: An abandoned halfling hill. Currently being investigated by 4 leech headed halflings.

author: Trent B
description: A lake! 3 crocodiles. Not claw claw bite.

author: Noah Marshall
description: More Lake! The swampy ill-defined southern border of [[1221]]. A sunken castle whose three exposed towers are home to a tribe of 22 Gatormen.

author: Matt Maranda
description: A lost caravan of halflings are attempting to return to the village in [[1127]]. If searched they have several barrels with mushrooms hidden inside, but deny all knowledge of truffle hunting and most certainly not in forests [[1323]].

author: Claytonian JP
description: This grassy area is a favorite of the Claw Claw Bite Society, a group of battle reenactors. If the PCs have heroic ancestors, someone will be taking said ancestors' role, probably to the dissatisfaction of the PCs.

author: Steve Sigety
description: In a clearing, a wicker basket containing one suit of gnome-sized crabshell armor.

author: Ray Colina
description: The lake waters here are algae filled. A giant bass lurks beneath the waters.

author: Ray Colina
description: The monkey people from [[0505]] have built a tree-fortress here. They are hostile to outsiders. Baboon people also roam here, they make almost daily raids on the monkey people.

author: Trent B
description: A small coterie of fisherdwarfs live here, 4 males and their families. They trade their surfacefish with the denizens of the endless tunnels below their homes and therefore having interesting tunnel-goods to trade to travellers.

author: Ray Colina
description: This small forested island is surrounded by shoals; only shallow draft ships may approach. At the island's center is black pool of weltering putrescent muck. So inauspicious is this muck that no one sane can approach any closer than fifty feet to the pool.

author: Trent B
description: 13 racist pirates on a small, relatively fast vessel. They have firearms and gunpowder stolen from Corvid (crowman) tinkers in [[1403]].

author: Noah Marshall
description: 3 Empusa Sisters living in a sea spire, who keep lured sailors as silver mining slaves. 3 racist pirates from [[1303]] serve as enforcers in their gang of 32 thralls.

author: Trent B
description: A rotted old shipwreck, home to octopus and crabs. Silverware and coins valuing 238 GP in the sunken hold.

author: Noah Marshall
description: d4 Hornless outcasts of the Mino-Gorgs from [[1205]]. Roll 1d4 1- Disenfranchised and spoiling for a fight 2- Lonely and spoiling for adventure 3- Starving and will buddy up to get some food 4- Revolutionaries looking to take back their homes

author: Tom Hudson
description: A small shrine in pseudo-Greek style (round platform, pillars, shallow domed roof). The oculus is an inobvious portal. Disturbed earth nearby from filled-in pits.

author: Thomas Fitzgerald
description: Belligerent drunken gnome treading water

author: Matt Maranda
description: Sheep graze here. The shepherd carries a silvered short sword an heirloom from his grandfather's time in the war.

author: Trent B
description: WORMWALLOW (Settlement) Humans and Froglings, renowned for their fine weapons and steelcraft. Froglings gather Bog-ore from [[1310]], and humans extract Iron and craft shears and blades from fine alloys. Master Smith Eerovir is father to the cursed child in [[1003]] and offers a reward of an enchanted masterwork broadsword for his safe return.

author: Trent B
description: A boggy mire, exploited and hunted by the men/froglings of Wormwallow [[1309]]. Inhabited by dangerous bogworms, which lay submerged and attack things with their paralyzing tentacles for food and nutrients. 2-in-6 Chance of incidental corpse-treasure near bogworm infestations.

author: Matt Maranda
description: is +Zak Smith  The mountaintop ruin of a black marble city that once sprawled from [[1311]] to [[1616]] is now the home an ancient dracolisk.

author: Adam Thornton
description: Abandoned silver mine.  Rails, minecarts, mining tools, but nothing both valuable and portable.

author: Shaine Edwards
description: amid broken chunks if black marble lies a ninety pound pellet from the owl in [[1213]]. It contains a hair, bones, and skull that still bears a magical crystal crown.

author: Casey Garske
description: In a secluded valley, a stone golem refugee from [[0814]] tends a small cockatrice farm. He is intelligent and friendly, but the cockatrices are not and the stone golem is very protective of them.

author: Trent B
description: A corner of a large black-marble building juts forth from an old landslide. If excavated 6 yards down, the entrance reveals old, weakened shelves of decomposed fabric stores and a small pile (4x4 yards) of enchanted black/silver fabric (Keeps wearer warm/cool, resistant to cutting).

author: Richard Rush
description: A lazy creek flows through this area; the corpses of dead cattle float behind some weeds. Drinking the water without purifying it in some way will likely cause dysentery.

author: Trent B
description: Green rolling hills and black marble ruins, with a fractured, overgrown marble path leading north northeast.

author: Gabriel Perez Gallardi
description: In a hole in the ground... ...I don't know what lives in there but it goes all the way down to the mine from [[1217]].

author: Dan Cassar
description: A small river runs through the woods here.  A family of good-natured Giant Otters live in it.

author: Dan Cassar
description: An otherwise normal-looking tree in this forest bears deep purple apples each spring.  Eating an entire apple causes one to forget everything that has happened since the previous spring.

author: Trent B
description: CLOVECRUSHED (Settlement) 6-7ft tall emaciated goatheaded humanoids live in a series of predominately subterranean dwellings and shrines to Akerbeltz [[1021]].
